newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish Riksbank board meets but no rate changes.
newsitem.headline: Swedish Riksbank board meets but no rate changes.

text.p: The board of Sweden's central bank, the Riksbank, ended a meeting on Tuesday with no changes announced to interest rates.
The Riksbank last lowered its key interest rate, the repo rate, on December 17. It currently stands at 4.10 percent and was left unchanged at the bank's weekly operation at 0730 GMT on Tuesday.
Its other key rates, the deposit and lending rates, are currently 3.75 percent and 5.25 percent respectively.
The bank's board will next meet on April 10.
